I’m at our Lincolnshire office today calling back constituents who wrote in regarding the government shutdown. Our office is open today — please give us a call at 847-383-4870 if you have any questions or comments! pic.twitter.com/E4OUp7qtMO
In a year when so many brave voices have come forward, we need to reauthorize #VAWA immediately to protect needed resources to survivors of domestic violence & sexual assault.

I’ve been working w/ colleagues to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act since summer when I helped introduce the legislation. It’s shameful that GOP leadership has not brought the measure up for a vote and allowed the program to expire. #VAWA https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/politics/ct-violence-against-women-act-expire-government-shutdown-20181221-story.html …

The American people deserve better. President Trump is once again putting politics ahead of the public good and hurting working families with his decision to shut down our government. https://schneider.house.gov/media/press-releases/schneider-statement-impending-government-shutdown …

I’m grateful for Secretary Mattis’s service and steady hand at the Department of Defense. For our country’s sake, the Senate must only approve a new Secretary similarly committed to maintaining our leadership abroad and standing up to the President when he’s wrong. https://twitter.com/NPR/status/1075900145450000384 …

We all share the desire to fully defeat ISIS, end the civil war in Syria, and thwart Iran’s nefarious influence. Unfortunately, the President’s approach will more likely push each of these objectives further out of reach.

I am profoundly concerned by President Trump’s abrupt announcement of a withdrawal of all American forces from Syria—it is premature and leaves our objectives in the region dangerously incomplete. https://schneider.house.gov/media/press-releases/statement-withdrawal-american-troops-syria …
I dropped by the Glenbrook North HS Winter Showcase this afternoon. Great artwork by the students! pic.twitter.com/RE3NV6jP6r

The Admin has an obligation to end the sabotage and instead defend the law.  More importantly, I encourage Pres. to work w/ incoming Democratic majority to develop health care solutions that lower cost, improve care, and expand coverage to more Americans. https://schneider.house.gov/media/press-releases/statement-affordable-care-act-court-ruling …

But the law remains under assault from an Administration willing to remove protections for people with pre-existing conditions, promote inadequate and incomplete insurance plans, and slash funding for open enrollment advertising and assistance.
Important to know: the Affordable Care Act will stay in effect while this ruling is appealed. #ACA https://twitter.com/NPRHealth/status/1074677053226512390 …

I join the nation in mourning his loss and offer my sincere condolences to the Bush family.

George H.W. Bush lived a life of integrity and decency dedicated to service to our country – as a WWII pilot, Member of Congress, CIA director, Ambassador, VP, and finally 41st President. While party was important to him, he was a statesman who put country first.
